JavaScript - scope and Environment

the scope defines the part of the program where a variable or a function is visible/accessbile.

the variables defined outside all the functions and blocks are available throughout the code. these are called Global Variables.

var num1 =10; //num1 is a global Variable function sum(num2){ var total = num1 + num2;//total is a local function console.log(total); //local scope of num1 } console.log(num1) //Global scope of num1
